Schedule/SomeWork.description: Execution performance of calling marl::schedule() with a reasonable work load.

Schedule/SomeWorkWorkerAffinityOneOf.description: Execution performance of calling marl::schedule() with a reasonable work load, using worker threads pinned to individual cores.

Schedule/Empty.description: Execution performance of calling marl::schedule() with an empty function.

BlockingCall.description:
Time taken to perform a call to marl::blocking_call().
Requires creating a std::thread, and calling join() on it.

Defer.description: Time taken to perform a call to marl::defer().

Schedule/Event.description: Execution performance of a chain of tasks each blocked by an event that's signalled by the previous task.

Schedule/EventBaton.description: Execution performance of two tasks, that frequently alternate execution.

Schedule/Ticket.description: Execution performance of a chain of tasks each blocked by ticket from a marl::Ticket::Queue.

Schedule/WaitGroup.description: Execution performance of calling marl::WaitGroup::done() on a number of tasks, and waiting for all to complete with marl::WaitGroup::wait().

SingleQueueTaskExecutor.description:
Reference benchmark that does not use marl.
A simple multi-thread, single-queue task executor that shares a single mutex across N threads.
This implementation suffers from lock contention.

MultiQueueTaskExecutor.description:
Reference benchmark that does not use marl.
A simple multi-thread, multi-queue task executor that avoids lock contention.
Tasks queues are evenly balanced, and each should take an equal amount of time to execute.
